section.title: Overview
section.para: GMAT functions are very useful and work nearly the same as they do in most programming languages. They may be invoked using the Call Function command covered here.

section.title: Listing of Objects and Commands that interact

listitem.para: Function
Any function that you create will be available to the Call Function command for use.
Spacecraft
All of the standard spacecraft object properties are available for function inputs and outputs.
Impulsive Burn
Both the standard direction sets of Elements 1, 2, and 3, as well as V, N, and B are available for function inputs and outputs.
Variable
Variables are available as values for both input and output.
Array
Arrays are available as data for both input and output.
String
Strings are available as data for both input and output.

section.title: Using the Call Function Command in the GUI
section.para: The Call Function Command is is useful in that

listitem.para: Output - Display
This is where the Objects or values selected for output are displayed.
View (Output) - Button
This button brings up the standard Parameter Select dialog box. It allows you to add objects to the list of outputs.
Function - Drop Down Menu
This is where you select the function that will be called by the Call Function command.
Input - Display
This is where the Objects or values selected for input are displayed.
View (Input) - Button
This button also brings up the standard Parameter Select dialog box. It allows you to add objects to the list of inputs.

section.title: Using the Call Function Command in the script

programlisting.code:
%Function call with Inputs and Outputs GMAT [OutputList] = Function(InputList)
%Function call with Outputs only GMAT [OutputList] = Function
%Function call with Inputs only GMAT Function(InputList)
Function call with no Inputs or Outputs GMAT Function

% Matlab function call without inputs or outputs
% Syntax 1 GMAT clearAll
% Syntax 2 GMAT [ ] = clearAll( )

entry.para: Options: [ Variables, Arrays, S/C, Paramters, any other user-defined parameters, or blank. Multiple outputs must be expressed in a comma delimited list format ]
The OutputList option allows the user to set the output of Function to a user defined parameter.
Options: [ Variables, Arrays, S/C, Paramters, any other user-defined parameters, or blank. Multiple inputs must be expressed in a comma delimited list format. ]
The InputList option allows the user to set the input of Function to a user defined parameter.

The Function option allows the user to set the function that will be called in a specific location of the mission sequence. The function has to be defined before it can be used in the CallFunction Command.
